And the remaining estimate is not the same as the one calculated directly from an excel export.

Planning board and burndown chart 676 days
Excel Export: 200 days

For more information refer to screenshot.

This affects what ever the current version is on JAC.
The magnifying glass icon used in the top left of cards (when you hover) is loaded from http://confluence.atlassian.com/images/icons/magnify_16.png

This seems unnecessary. I only noticed because I work remotely via the authenticating proxy and see multiple authentication requests when I try to access the task board. There are a few others that I haven't been able to track down yet.

fields.description:
We recently upgraded Jira from 4.0 to 4.2 and Green Hopper 5.3 as well as 5.4 is not working getting an exception when clicked on Task Board under Agile menu. 

I am not able to view the Task Board in Jira under the 'Agile' menu. It shows the following exception: 

An error occurred whilst rendering this message. Please contact the administrators, and inform them of this bug. Details: ------- org.apache.velocity.exception.MethodInvocationException: Invocation of method 'isByBoardFilterSupported' in class com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira.boards.TaskBoard threw exception class java.lang.NullPointerException : null at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTIdentifier.execute(ASTIdentifier.java:183) at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTReference.execute(ASTReference.java:175) at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTReference.evaluate(ASTReference.java:307) at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTExpression.evaluate(ASTExpression.java:45) at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTIfStatement.render(ASTIfStatement.java:68) at ..... 

Let me know if you need any more details.

Thanks,
Prachi

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: GreenHopper users ask for the feature to customize burndown dependency. So far, the burndown is based on the "Done" column of Task Board Column Mapping, which is not so convenient for some scenarios. They want the burndown definition can be independent from Task Board Column Mapping and customizable to base on the specific statuses/resolution.
fields.summary: GreenHopper users want to customize burndown dependency

fields.description:
I'm finding that if you freshly import data from an external system such as Bugzilla, and then turn on Ranking in Greenhopper, you start getting these errors randomly when viewing the Planning Board.  To reproduce it, you have to click through the Projects while in the planning board.

{code}

        at $Proxy138.search(Unknown Source)
        at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor392.invoke(Unknown Source)

fields.description:
In JIRA, if a field is required there is a 'None' option automatically selected. 
This forces the user to make a selection. This is important UI and often the intention when not setting a default for any field configuration.

I would like the GreenHopper cards to do this too. 


see  JRA-3666

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Some customers want new issues that are raised to appear at the top of the planning board, currently to achieve this you have to select the top-most bug so when a new card is created it appears above the highlighted bug.

It should be possible to have a default rank set so new cards will appear at that rank automatically. Currently people are trying (understandably) to edit the default value of the Rank custom field (GHS-2312, GHS-2590) but it throws a stack trace (or did up until GH 5.4 anyway). A separate option within GreenHopper's settings to configure this would be great.
fields.summary: Ability to choose default rank for new bugs

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
If you close issue (by "resolve", for example) which has still some remaining estimate left, then this will be cleared to 0 in jiraissue table, but no record will be put in changeitem/changegroup tables. Thus, jira will be still adding last value of estimation to the "todo" value (and also green line on chart), nevertheless you cannot see this value in issue details. This way we have inconsistency between sum of "remaining" in each tasks, and on the chart (and version/project summaries).

(update)
I've checked, that this setting of 'estimated' to zero is done by our workflow:

- THEN
The Remaining Estimate of the issue will be set to 0h.
— THEN
Fire a Issue Resolved event that can be processed by the listeners.

...but I still treat this as a bug as this is perfectly possible to change some value without adding record in change* tables and green hopper doesn't support such case properly.

{code}
mysql> select issueid, AUTHOR, CREATED, FIELD, oldvalue / 3600, newvalue / 3600 from changegroup left join changeitem on ( changeitem.groupid = changegroup.id ) where issueid = 44080 and field = 'timeestimate';
+---------+--------+---------------------+--------------+-----------------+-----------------+
| issueid | AUTHOR | CREATED             | FIELD        | oldvalue / 3600 | newvalue / 3600 |
+---------+--------+---------------------+--------------+-----------------+-----------------+
|   44080 | pp5091 | 2010-12-17 12:16:57 | timeestimate |               5 |               3 |
+---------+--------+---------------------+--------------+-----------------+-----------------+
1 row in set (0.00 sec)

mysql> select id, pkey, TIMEESTIMATE / 3600, TIMEORIGINALESTIMATE / 3600, TIMESPENT / 3600 from jiraissue where pkey = 'SEM-2791';
+-------+----------+---------------------+-----------------------------+------------------+
| id    | pkey     | TIMEESTIMATE / 3600 | TIMEORIGINALESTIMATE / 3600 | TIMESPENT / 3600 |
+-------+----------+---------------------+-----------------------------+------------------+
| 44080 | SEM-2791 |              0.0000 |                      5.0000 |           2.0000 |
+-------+----------+---------------------+-----------------------------+------------------+
1 row in set (0.00 sec)
{code}

Actually I'm not sure if this is bug in GreenHopper or rather in Jira itself - but it appears in GreenHopper, so I post it here.
fields.summary: Invalid value for remaining estimate when closing issue without setting remaining to 0

fields.description:
It seems to have to do specifically the 'Velocity' tab of the Agile Gadget on JIRA's dashboard. The chart displayed in this tab overlooks the 'context' option and shows the chart you last see when you check Agile > Chart Board > Value Chart. This is true, regardless of the filter type you choose on the gadget. This is also user specific, meaning it will show the user's last access to that particular chart.

For example:

    * UserA goes to Agile > Chart Board and selects the options: Default context, version SPRINT, Value Chart, Story Points, Children.
    * UserA will now always see that same chart when looking at his Agile Gadget > Velocity regardless of the context chosen. Changing the other fields, such as the version will still update the charts to the correct version type.
    * Any other user accessing the Agile Gadget will see their own chart, following the same condition as mentioned above. The 'context' option is also overlooked. Meaning, users will then see different charts depending on their cached history with the chart.
fields.summary: 'Velocity' tab of the Agile Gadget seems to ignore the 'Context' option when displaying charts.

fields.description:
We have been working on a QA taskboard in JAC, so that we can view all tasks assigned to QA across all of the subteams, to give us an overview of the current sprint and the work we have committed to.

There is a problem in that the Confluence subteams are working concurrently on different versions - 3.5 and 4.0. The UI in GH only allows us to view one of these at a time, so we cannot get the overview we are looking for.

There are various ways we can workaround this, but it would be great if GH catered for this usecase.

fields.description:
On the task board, when a task gets moved to the Done column, it disappears.  When you click on the Issue Navigator button to show the query, it shows the very incorrect query that's being generated.  Here's an example:

project = TEST AND fixVersion = "Sprint 4" AND assignee = test AND status in (Resolved, Closed) AND NOT status in (Resolved, Closed) ORDER BY Ranking ASC, key ASC

This incorrect query appears to be generated for whatever column is in the far right.  If I create a Task Board column and put it to the right, a similar always-false query gets generated.

This problem also manifests in the Chart Board.  If, for example, my project starts with 250 story points.  Two days in, someone completes a task worth 8 points.  When I go to the Burndown chart of Story Points, what I expect to see is two days at 250 points and one day at 242 points.  What happens, however, is that 8 points are deducted from all 3 days and what I see on day 3 is three days at 242 points.  The 8-point task completely disappears from the chart.
fields.summary: Tasks marked "Done" disappear from Greenhopper

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Please add a Total Scope line to the burnup chart in the Chart Board.  This would show the total number of story points (or points of business value) that WERE included in the selected version on each chart date.

The line would often be flat - i.e. a horizontal line at 20 if there are 20 story points (of all statuses) in the sprint.  But the line would go up for days on which scope was added to the sprint.

To me this is the whole point of a burnup chart - if you have increasing scope you can see that you're still making progress but toward a moving target.  A burndown chart shows this as a lack of progress.

The historical scope info required would also be very helpful in calculating velocity and planning new sprints.
fields.summary: Add Scope line to burnup charts

Taskboard is incorrectly labeling the columns once their positions have changed.  It follows the following rules:

    * 'To Do' (red) section takes the first two columns.
          o Exception: If the first column has no issues, or is empty, the entire 'To Do' section becomes the 'In Progress' section
          o Exception: If the second column has no issues, this column becomes the 'In Progress' section
    * 'Done (green) section is very last column.
          o Exception: If the last column is empty, it becomes the 'In Progress' section.
    * 'In Progress' (yellow) is all the sections between the 'To Do' and 'Done' sections, including any exceptions from them.

fields.description:
h4. Symptom
When there are the multiple users have a ranking on the same version concurrently, the UI may hang, and the below ConcurrentModificationException is thrown in log file
{noformat}
java.util.ConcurrentModificationException
at java.util.TreeMap$PrivateEntryIterator.nextEntry(TreeMap.java:1100)
at java.util.TreeMap$KeyIterator.next(TreeMap.java:1154)
at com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira.customfields.RankingCFType.reIndexAll(RankingCFType.java:213)
at com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira.customfields.RankingCFType.updateValue(RankingCFType.java:409)
at com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira.customfields.RankingCFType.updateValue(RankingCFType.java:177)
at com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira.actions.MultipleRankingAction.doRank(MultipleRankingAction.java:47)
...
{noformat}

h4. Cause
It seems that in com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira.customfields.RankingCFType TreeMap is used by a static way without synchronized. 
We should fix this problem, and also consider how to handle the concurrent ranking operations by a more friendly method.
fields.summary: Ranking does not support concurrent operations

fields.description:
GH produces queries like the following when viewing the TaskBoard.jspa

{noformat}
 JQL Query: {project = 10240} AND {fixVersion = 14978} AND ( {fixVersion is EMPTY} OR {fixVersion in unreleasedVersions(JRA)} ) AND {parent = "JRA-19051"} AND ( {status in ("1", "10005", "10033", "4", "10004")} OR {status = "3"} OR {status in ("6", "5")} ) AND {issuetype in subTaskIssueTypes()} order by cf ASC, key ASC
{noformat}

There are a number of potential speedups here:

# This query has lots of redundant clauses. When you specify {{fixVersion = 14978}} you don't need the {{fixVersion is EMPTY OR fixVersion in unreleasedVersions(JRA)}} part at all. 
# It is much quicker to use issues IDs as arguments to the parent clause.
# ...
fields.summary: GH is producting inefficient queries when viewing the TaskBoard

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When viewing the task board there are 35 JQL queries run on my instance of which only 21 are unique (i.e. GH is issuing the same query multiple times). Check out [^query.txt] for all the queries that are actually run. On instances with a large number of issues, this causes a lot of pain because each search can take between 100-1000ms and as such can blow the task board loading over ~ 30seconds. Please reduce the number of queries. 

For example, GH seems to be using queries to filter the sub-tasks and the parents from issues without sub-tasks. It believe it would be better to just find all the issues that GH is going to display and then filter them in memory.
fields.summary: Investigate: Executes way too many queries when displaying the taskboard.

fields.description:
Please restore the old transition screen behavior that made it easy and intuitive to close or resolve tasks on the Task Board.

Previously the Greenhopper transition screen presented the user with an option to close or resolve a task when a card was dropped in the done column. On the same screen the remaining estimate was automatically set to 0, with the ability to be changed. Also when the tranition was completed the burndown graph would automatically show the correct reduction in outstanding hours, even though the user was not required to log work on the close / resolve transition.

In version 5.3 the user is now presented with the standard Jira transition screen, which presents the following extremely annoying behaviors:
 1. The user now has to log work manually to correctly update the burndown graph
 2. The "Log Work" field is not included by default on the transition screen, so to get a working system out of the box the user have to change a standard build-in screen.
 3. Due to 1. and 2. above the user frequently forgets to log work and then closes the isue. In this case to fix the burndown graph, the administrator has to filter through all the 
    closed issues that might have inaccurate / incomplete work log entries, reopen them, and then close them while logging the matching number of hours to reflect a correct burndown graph.
 4. The remaining estimate is not automatically set to 0, so together with all of the above, renders a very tedious and cumborsome Task Board expirience.
fields.summary: Restore transition screen behavior

Problem:
The "Agile Charts" show correct data for each context (Agile -> Chart board -> Statistics burndown chart / story points) - see attached images.

Maybe filter sharing makes charting gadget uncapable of resolving contexts propertly?

fields.description:
When using drag & drop in card view, I often find it frustrating to determine where cards will end up when I drag one card on top of another one. Sometimes it is positioned before the drop target, sometimes behind it. It does not seem to matter whether I drop onto the left or the right side of the card. It may depend on whether I'm dragging from one row to another or within a row. Trying to drop into the space between cards does nothing at all.

I'd make a few suggestions:

* Drop zones should be consistent. I would recommend dividing the card in two and looking at where the mouse pointer is when dropping. If it's on the left half of the card, drop before. If it's on the right half of the card, drop after.
* The space between cards should be a valid drop zone.
* Rather than highlighting the card that the mouse is over, I would add an indicator to the space between cards where the dropped issue will appear.
* When hovering over an invalid drop zone, change the indicator to show that the card will return to the original location. Maybe change the mouse cursor style to {{no-drop}} as well (see http://www.quirksmode.org/css/cursor.html).
fields.summary: When reordering with drag & drop in card view, it is unclear where the dropped card will be positioned

fields.description:
Hi,
In the Release Board view in Agile tab, it shows the completed Sprints, story points completed so far, and also has the target (total number of story points already estimated).

It would be really nice (and the Product Owners often ask this) for a prediction on when we might complete a project.

Note green-hopper has all the information, it knows the Velocity and can provide a trend line (already in the legend) but not shown, if the trend line could be extended until it reaches the total story points (in the future) this would provide a really good prediction and we could print the graph and show to all stakeholders. Future sprints could be different colour or opaque (to indicate future sprints) 

As work progresses and stories added and completed, changes to the release prediction should be easily seen and decisions can be made if needed.

Additional information which could be shown: Number of expected Sprints needed to reach Total story points, Expected date, using release cycle period (calculated or averaged using release dates of sprint versions)...
fields.summary: Greenhopper - provide a Release plan projection

fields.description:
When I change the text of the Summary field in List view, the characters displayed do not keep up with typing speed. This is problematic during sprint planning, when five people are waiting around for my typing to complete.

1. Open the Planning Board in List view. (When I first encountered this bug I had about 15 cards displayed.)
2. Click the pencil icon next to the Summary field for one card. 
3. Begin typing.

RESULT
Displayed characters do not even remotely keep up with typing speed. Characters display at a rate of about 2 per second, while my typing speed is around 8 chars per second (90 wpm).

I noticed there is a remaining character count that decreases as I type. If that is the culprit I wouldn't mind turning it off.

There are other actions that cause us to automatically switch out of Task Board and into Planning Board.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h4. Symptom
'Original Estimate' shown in Burndown chart may not correct for the specific date.

h4. Cause
When work is log against issue on start date of version without remaining estmate is changed with it, that issue's estimate time may not be counted into the 'Original Estimate' shown in Burndown chart, because if there is any work logging in planning session (version start date), GreenHopper tries to catch the related remaining estimate after logging work to reflect the planned estimate, but it may run out of gear when failing to find it.

h4. Workaround
Since this kind of work logging should be a rare scenario, adjusting version to start from the date before or after the current 'start date' may fix the burndown chart.
fields.summary: Original estimate of Burndown Chart can be wrong when work is logged on version start date without changing remaining estimate

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
It happens to me very often that I accidentally click the "Close" button on the modal screen of an issue when I mean to click the "Resolve" button, losing my resolution comment. This is particularly easy to fall into the trap if the modal screen is not scrolled down enough to show the "Resolve" button.

Now I have to repeatedly remind myself not to fall into the trap again whenever I work with a modal screen of GH. This makes using GH a very unpleasant experience for me.

I propose to replace the "Close" button of modal screens with a round cross icon on the top-left or top-right of the modal screens. (The button panel can be hidden if no other buttons are left.)

Alternatively, please warn the user if the "Close" button is clicked but the user has entered some changes on the modal screen, just like what JIRA does.
fields.summary: It is easy to accidentally close a JIRA iframe and lose changes
